reviewText:
This review does not take in account the in-game store. It is a review based on the gaming experience ignoring the pricing factor,

I was a big fan of the left for dead series and was really anxious for Evolve. Thought the game is good, it is lacking content and level variety.

But my main reason for the thumb down is simply because of the bugs and lag issues. I bought this game with 2 of my friends and I am the only one that can play it. One friend as everytime the protocol error , so he wasn't able to play a single match and the other gets kick out game 50% of time and has lag issue.

On my end, when playing the monster I get lag spike randomly (not sure if it's network or graphics) but its a pain in the *ss.

The game as been out for 3 weeks now, all their focus was on bugs for Xbox-One, with no news for the PC version.
This game was meant to play with friends and establish strategies, thus if you are a solo player go with the monster otherwise you will get in groups that most of the time don't have any strategies and just run around the map.
This game was made to communicate and create tactics, but with strangers on your team it become more complexe.

So after 43hours of gameplay in Pug, running around to find the monster in the same jungle look & feel, I just get bored. I am ready to say goodbye to Shear, maybe will be back later when the bugs are fix and new maps are available.

reviewText:
The thing with evolve is: I Feel like i bought a 60 Dollar Season Pass. Someone called the game a glorified DLC shopping mall. While i can't argue with that, i still think that there's a lot of fun to have with this game, but the price tag (you have to include the season pass as well as some of the content is literally stripped from the main game) is just not good.

The game has great polish, but it can't overshadow the shortcomings that exist since the first open beta. Things like friends can't connect via online lobby and start a game (but very well can if one opens a game, starts it and then the other hot joins with some luck) those have been adressed by the community but never where adressed by the developer. Which even further feeds the feeling that the Betas where in fact marketing events instead of bug-hunting parties.

In the end, evolve isn't bad. Just very medicore and on a price tag that's too muchin my opinion.

reviewText:
Honestly, I wish I hadn't bought Evolve. I pre-ordered the game a long time before it came out and forgot about it. If I had remembered, I would have canceled it. The gameplay is just alright, but it's definitely not worth $60. From my experience, matches as a human are mostly just running around with sporadic bouts of shooting. As a monster, you mostly run away. You also lose more often than not. Maybe it's because the starting monster is terrible. I did manage to join a game where I got to play as the Wraith and it was way more fun than the Goliath. Unfortunately, I don't think I want to play enough of this game in order to unlock the Wraith.

Then there's the DLC. I can't believe that a $60 Multiplayer only game has this much DLC, it's ridiculous. It makes the whole game feel like a money grab and not a piece of entertainment.

I've run into another problem as well. I often get placed into games that are in progress and many of those are almost over. I even got placed into a game that ended right after I loaded.

reviewText:
Ok so lets debunk some things.

first, the game is good.  its well polished, and at least for me i have experience little to no issues (other then a bug with my mouse cursor and steam overlay)

the mechanics are sound

id even say the balance is good, each class has its own hook that nobody else can replicate, while sharing a main feature.

i dont even mind the searching for the monster parts as humans.

and being a monster is most fun ive had in a while.

if i was to rate the game based soley on the merits of its gameplay id give it a easy 10/10.  but its not that simple

first is its lack of real content, for a game in development for 5 years, it has very little going on.  there is a reason they compare it to titanfall.  thats not to say whats there isnt good, and a certain type of person will not ever get really bored of it but rather dig deeper and find the nuances and depth of gameplay to craft truly memorable experiences.

subtract 1 point for lack of real content, 9/10 is still stellar! at least for what it is.

thats right

3 skins

these skins have been available from day 1, this is true day 1 dlc

some of you may go but it has no effect on gameplay"

reviewText:
EVOLVE:
~~~~~~~

Evolve is a combination of Team Fortress 2 and a touch of Left for Dead 1 and 2.  Evolve was essentially designed to be a co-op game but upon its release a solo campaign was added (I have not try it as yet).

As soon as you enter the game, you will be pointed to the monster tutorial. It is a good idea to go through it as you will find out soon enough into the game, being the monster is not as easy as it seems.

The multiplayer setup is very similar to the Call of Duty series where you will be directed to a game with an open slot if you do not setup your own game.

You can choose to be the monster or the hunters. Whatever characters you choose before starting a game, you will have an allocation of 3 points and you will be able to distribute them to your character skills.   Hunters are divided into 4 categories. You can be Assault, Medic, Support or Trapper and each have their own specific weapons and gizmos. It is quite fun to play the hunters but the best part in this game for me is playing the monster without a doubt. I like the fact that if it’s the first time you use one of the characters you will have a quick and details video on their equipments (weapons) and skills before the game starts.

The controls are very good, mind you if you play the monster it will take you time to master them but boy it is fun!

The game is visually splendid and runs very well.

Maps are waste and well laid out but in my opinion their look all very similar. In each map you will find animals and not all of them are scared of you. They will attack you pretty much on the spot if they see you. Being the monster, “KILL” them “EAT” them and EVOLVE!  If you are the hunters “KILL” them and be “HEAL”!

I enjoy this game. However, I can’t get pass the fact that EVOLVE in my opinion is a polished version of TF2 (minus the cart) set in another world with a monster and without a 32 slots server.

It is fun but not a ground breaking game that it was supposed to be. It might Evolve and become one!

Games like this one have a big marketing budget and that unfortunately affects the pricing. I think the price is slightly too high.

Positives:
~~~~~~~

-	Great Graphics
-	Large Maps
-	Different Monsters with they own characteristics
-	Playing the monster is challenging
-	Achievements
-	Trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Maps look similar
-	Price point slightly too high

Overall, I enjoy the game. It is fun playing the monster!

7.9 / 10

reviewText:
I played BETA and enjoyed my time, but I try to be a game collecting completionist and I refuse to pay $100 for a multiplayer-based game and bonus content. That is just absurd.

Plus two days after launch and there's already been like a 15k drop in players.
A drop in players. On a multiplayer based game.
Yeah, no thanks.

Sad thing is Turtle Rock Studios made their money back so they aren't hurting at all.

They duped people worldwide into preordering for a project that they bragged won two awards in one year...yet kept pushing the release date. That right there should have been everyone's red flag.
Red flag number 2 should have been when they discussed their marketing strategy - Literally stating they have 100% plans for future DLC that we can prepurchase and wait to be released, even more money in their pockets.

All of this wait and hype has been backed up solely on their word and their small track record of left 4 dead & left 4 dead 2.
That's it. But we ate it up.
They're rolling in their dough while we get the ♥♥♥♥-end of the stick.

But that's evolution, baby.

reviewText:
So, after reading tons of bad reviews from earlier this year I went into the free weekend with lack-luster expectations. I was very happily rebuffed by a fantastically fun game. The issues regarding finding matches, or matches that had already started, were non-existent (with the latest update[s]?). The gameplay seemed to be wonderfully balanced between good teamwork on the side of the hunters and solid, intelligent play on the side of the monster.

There are absolutely certain maps which 'favor' specific monsters -- giving the monster an edge in certain ways -- but this in no way keeps the game from being fair or playable. Often hunter losses are caused by a team that's not communicating and, surprisingly, I ran into a lot of PUGs that were actively using their mics and communicating. Only a handful of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s soured that, and often they had a degree of poignance to their asshatiness (non-mic'd player totally ignoring everyone and legitimately helping the monster).

Unlike Titanfall which very, very loosely had a storyline stuck around its matches Evolve actually FEELS fleshed out and leaves you asking questions in good ways (e.g., who is CIG9? What happened on Shear? Is your preferred Hunter actually a good guy... or is he just doing it for fun?).

Of course, I can't support the tons and tons of DLC, but it's honestly cool. Each character in each class feels unique and fun and, I dare say, is worth the cash for them.

Overall, I'd totally recommend the game, especially at $19.99.

reviewText:
Man oh man, I wish I could write a positive review of this game, but I just can't.  I've put about thirty hours into the game since release, plus another 15-20 from the alpha/beta phase.  The concept is sound.  The visual design is pretty rad.

This.  Game.  Is.  Not.  Worth.  Sixty.  Bucks.

Don't think I'm somebody who insists that every game MUST have a singleplayer mode; I'm entirely fine with a game being multiplayer only.  IF it has the content and balance to justify it.  And Evolve doesn't, on either score.

Except for the Goliath, the Monsters are unbalanced.  The way to counter that imbalance is use the Lazarus character, which is one of the most phenomenally moronic design choices I've ever seen in a game.  Monsters can down players, which puts strikes on them and drops their max health when revived.  Lazarus COMPLETELY negates this core element with a fast-recharging ability that takes less than a second to resurrect downed players.  And DEAD players.  And he can turn invisible.  And he has a fast-firing sniper rifle that generates weak points on the Monster.  Oh, and that rez ability?  Using it means a rezzed player doesn't get a strike for being downed, or even COMPLETELY DEAD.  Once you get into the higher levels, the gameplay basically just centers around teams keeping Lazarus alive and protected.

This makes every fight a total chore for the Monster, as the strike system is negated and only the Monster is the one losing health.

On top of that, the content is just not there to justify the cost.  And then the devs have the balls to have an overpriced season pass on top of THAT.

Save your money.  Buy something where the devs prioritized balance over unique" abilities and can also understand that it's pretty moronic to charge full retail price for a somewhat barebones game AND sell a DLC pass as well."

reviewText: It really pains me to write this review.  I love the idea, I love the execution of the game WHEN IT WORKS!  So many issues that are present, and then corrected!  Then new issues, or past issues come back up!  Ultimately the experience is one of a lack of trust!  I can't  trust myself to enjoy this game due to it's numerous bugs and its exploiting nature.  What I mean is the questionable cheating, the crashes to desktop, the amount of lag that appears out of nowhere when a turning point of the battle takes place, the system that bills this game as a casual 4v1, where it is actually highly competitive and requires competence and communications, but no system is in play to encourage it.  The numbers on the PC platform speak for itself.  This game was supposed to be the game that I convince my friends to jump into the PC platform for!  This is a true next gen game, in regards to both graphics and gameplay.  Yet, with the before mentioned, this is exactly WHY none of my buddies wants to invest in the PC platform.  This could have been great, and still has the potential to be great....Yet I can't help but feel that window may be gone.

reviewText:
I spent around 70 hours with this game. I enjoyed it in the beginning and most of that time was logged during the Alpha and Beta weekends. Since there was a timeframe I played as much as I could in that time.
I purchased the $100 PC monster race edition, I was excited! So excited! Only to be let down...
The new modes they talked about before release seemed better than they really are. They're all garbage and just distractions to the main mode. The real mode that is different is Defend but it only exists after complete 4 rounds on evacuation. How lame, the only mode that is actually different requires you to play other games to even start.

What happens with the game and why it isn't good is because the normal mode gets repetitive, sure it was fun and I did grind a lot of hours but that was just to unlock the other Hunters. Wowie, after unlocking everyone there was no reason to play and I realised how empty it really was. Unfortunately they added DLC and it just wasn't worth it. Yeah more Hunters and another monster?! Still same boring gameplay that I've done already. Also the balance isn't there. Literally all the Medics are worthless aside from Lazerus. Why? You get beat down to death and die. Lazerus can cloak and escape.

They added a new Arena mode, I think it was a very welcomed addition and actually gets rid of the repetitive nature of hunting the monster. I just feel like they need something new. Something more. 5 v 5 monster brawls. 8 hunters vs 2 monsters. 8 v 8 hunters or just 4 v 4. Sure some items will be obsolete, but they can just swap them out!

All the content is being shoved into the DLC and not the core game. It is very sad, I cry. I'm sure most people know this already but at least you can hear it from someone with enough hours to feel ashamed.

reviewText:
Let's make the point first.

DO NOT BUY EVOLVE.

This game is just terribly balanced for pub plays which is why Evolve completely screwed up.
Playing mostly as hunters, joined a pub match with only 40hour played monster, and the team lost.
Just because of other teammates' trival mistakes while monster could compensate his mistakes with ease.
Learning curves for hunters takes damn too long.

Too harsh for pub players. TRS's balance patch doesn't even consider them at all as well.
Even though if you are playing with premade team, you are gonna get SMASHED hard lots of times.
Because there are so many exploitings and strategies that favor monsters.

and one more thing, the PC playerbase is almost dead.
You can barely find a full match which means it is highly possible to join games in progress.
And that will give you undescribable frustration given the games are pubs.

Again, Don't buy this game, Don't support DLC-Cow company.
This is not worth $60.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

강력하게 사지 않는 걸 권합니다.

1. 밸런스 자체가 공방을 전혀 고려 안 하고 있습니다. 헌터가 아무리 혼자 잘해도 나머지가 못하면 초보몬스터가 아주 쉽게 이깁니다. 애초에 게임자체가 마이크를 쓰는 숙달된 팀과 몬스터를 싸우는 걸로 전제했기 때문이죠. 여기에 공방유저들이 들어갈 여지는 거의 없습니다. 본인 또한 공방큐는 승률이 좋지 못하고 같이 하는 파티분들하고 해야 그럭저럭 나오는데 공방에서라면 말할 것도 없는 밸런스죠. 이마저도 수정된 거고 게임초중기는 아주 개판이었습니다. TRS의 밸런싱의 능력을 잘 볼 수 있죠.

2. DLC 가격이 지나치게 높습니다.
혹자는 스킨들이니까 안 사면 되지 않겠느냐고 하겠는데 스킨은 둘째치고 추가헌터, 몬스터만 구매해도 40달러가 됩니다.컨텐츠가 적은 본판이 60달러인데 본판의 내용의 절반도 안 되는데 40달러라? 아주 정신 나가도 제대로 나간 겁니다.
이볼브 사실 거면 60달러 어치는 다른 가치있는 행위에 쓰세요. 그게 훨씬 바람직합니다.

3. 이미 게임 자체가 죽었습니다. 상기된 두가지 이유와 TRS의 멍청한 운영 등으로 타이탄폴보다 더 빠르게 인구가 감소했습니다. 출시 일주일때만해도 2만명이었으나 2주후에는 단 5천명으로 떨어지는 기적을 보셨나요? 지금은 채 1천명도 못넘습니다.
지금 세일하는데 낫지 않겠는가?  플레이어 수가 1천명인 상태로 달려온 게 몇달 됩니다. 지금 진입하는 유저와 기존유저와 실력이 그렇게 쉽게 좁혀질까요? 전혀 그렇지 않을 뿐더러 1번 이유에서 말한 거처럼 지금 진입하는 분들은 그냥 학살당합니다.
아무리 헌터가 혼자 잘해보려도 애써봐도 학살당합니다.
몬스터로 아무것도 모르면 그냥 학살당합니다.

베타 기대심리를 이용해서 매출을 늘려먹은 아주 나쁜 케이스입니다.
게임구성이나 밸런스나 운영이나 어느하나 충분하지 못하고 미숙한 게임이며 최소 2달은 더 개발하고 나왔어야 하는 게임이었죠.
재미있다고 600시간 넘게 해왔지만 그래도 해야할 말은 해야겠군요.

이 게임은 개판입니다. 사지마세요.

reviewText:
I missed the game on release due to the expensive price, and the massive negative press it got, not wanting to invest into a game that sounded like it was going to be terrible. And with the community shrinking insanely fast, I was happy with my choice. But I still wanted to try Evolve, because the game mechanics and style really intrigued me. I wanted to try, and as if by magic, a free weekend [no doubt in an attempt to try and bolster the game's small playerbase] came round and I quickly jumped on it, to give it a go. Because let's be honest, it's free for the weekend, doesn't matter what the DLC prices were like- it's free.

So I only played it for one day so far [was out today]. All my hours into the game so far were all put in, in one big go. I very quickly found that the game's design, people's co-operation and general flow of the game was really desirable. I got excited when the team played well, and the monster was also a good player. A lot of my games in the 7+ hour period I played resulted in 1 person living, spraying every last bullet against a stage 3 monster who was on less than 5% life, trying to kill it before going down in a spectacular state of 'going down with a fight'. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qYIjbHidB08 Was just one of mine, and it felt amazing to play, and as you can hear by the other person in game, to play around as well.

Yes, the DLC method isn't too desirable, and the game cost too much for what it was, but hey- until the 15th of september, I can get the game, and ALL the DLC for less than the game is first hand on Steam, which is already cheap enough at £25. So after selling off lots of steam badges and unneeded items, yes. I'm buying this game. And I intend on playing this game a lot more, because the last time I felt this type of excitement from an FPS...I was picking up CoD4 for the first time, as an FPS-hater 15 year old boy back in 2008.

reviewText: After the public access, i was hyped for this game (I think everybody was). We all thought the Hunt Mode was cool, and even though it was repetitive quickly, the advertised evacuation mode seemed like the game would offer loads of additional content once released.\nSadly, Evolve is nothing but a cash-grab, a huge disappointment and not worth your money. Evacuation-mode was nothing but five matches of other game-modes in a row (all pretty boring compared to the already quickly boring Hunt-mode). The in-game shop was already riddled with DLC. The lack of a campaign is the worst, since the characters themselves hint in some of the dialogue they speak of the rich lore this universe of hunters has. You will never learn anything else about it though (Maybe in future DLC ? -_-). reviewText:
There is an obvious lack of content.
The game is a running simulator.
All the elite skins are crap because they went the lazy route and reused the same boring design.

If you join a game with an experienced team and an experienced monster, then the game will occur as follows...

Run....run.....run some more...dome the monster.....monster just runs around in dome.....monster avoids serious damage...repeat until stage three....monster gets armor....monster focuses one hunter and no amount of shielding and heal will prevent them from dying after 4 direct special hits chained together....monster camps the body until his specials come back....repeat until all hunters are dead except for support....support cloaks and runs away....game draws on....hunters come back with 1-2 ticks....they die easier the second time....repeat until all hunters die or 25 minutes have passed....did you have fun?

Unless the 100% accurate description of what happens 95% of the time with experienced players thrills you, then don't buy the game. Maybe for 15 bucks. After 120+ hours, I regret all but 10 maybe.

There is no point in completing challenges for elite skins because they are garbage.

This expands to other games as well, but why do people grind for skins or loot if all they do with that loot is grind for more loot? You've accomplished nothing. Unless you are playing a game with thrilling multiplayer battles or amazing stories, then there is no point. I think during this review I just realized how much of my life I've wasted on games I don't enjoy such as this one.

And now I've realized how much time I've wasted writing this review. What is wrong with me?!

Do you still want to buy the game? No. Burning the money will give you more enjoyment.

reviewText:
When I visited Gamescom Cologne in 2014 and played Evolve for the first time I got hyped like crazy, cause I played it together with three friends against some random dude. It was great fun, nothing bad to say about it at that point.
Then the Alpha and later the Beta got me and my friend playing it for hours, trying to unlock new hunters over the Alpha/Beta-weekend. Still we had great fun.But in Beta the Game got a strange feel to it according to the content it offers to the players. Since not very much changed since Alpha, I was wondering how much content the game is going to offer.
Now that I played for like a week I decided to list some points for everyone and give a brief feedback:

PRO
-Great fun when playing with your friends
-The Maps look great
-Controlling the monster or hunters is pretty easy when you play for the first time, but mastering every single character is a challenge
->Even Beginners can quickly jump into it
-Custom games can lead to crazy matches

CONS:
-Not so much fun when playing alone
-->sometimes voice chat bugs, when playing with random people in matchmaking
-After some hours, you get the feeling like playing the same game all over and over again
-Matchmaking System unfair". A Elo/Ranking would be better
date:
since the lvl does not represent skill
-Balanced on high lvl ---> Unbalanced on lower skill levels
-No story mode
-It is like Cs:go --> play against other people
recommended: because bots/Ai are to bad..... -> not fun\n-You can unlock and level up in custom games against the computer-> People unlock stuff and get lvl up
hoursPlayed:
but do not improve->Matchmaking puts together player of same lvl but not the same skilllevel :(

---------------------------------------------------
After all I had great fun with the game when playing with my friends

reviewText:
Not for the casual gamer wanting to hop on and play a few matches every few days or so.  Requires practice and excellent communication skills if you want to win anything as a Hunter.  As the Monster, you'll need strategy and a loooot of experience with losing if you want to be skilled enough to win, as most of the hunters don't seem to be casual players.

The single player is useful, but won't help you with multiplayer, as the AI blindly follows you, or roams if you don't leave any traces. The monsters are usually the same way, and overcommit or flee, and not usually anything in between.

reviewText:
Well, i don't really know what to think about this game. I really like what they tried to do with it but Evolve just comes up short most of the times.

Hardly any players means you'll be playing with either the same people with a very varied skillrange or maybe even no players at all.

People keep disconnecting in fear that their stats on the leaderboards might fall. This is EXTREMELY common in Evolve public games. People also disconnect randomly anyway.

There's a huge discussion on balance in the game and in my experience it favors monsters most of the time. If you get an inexperienced player in your public game you're probably going to end up losing for as long as he's there.

Small glitches everywhere. Just today i was line of sighting a goliath hoping to escape the flames and it killed me through the wall.

What i really, really like about this game is the setting and lore. Every short story you get through the dialogue of the characters right before dropping onto Shear are amazing.

In the end, every single game turns into running around the same maps over and over while trying to get monster. Every single hunt-gamemode game feels exactly the same. There's really no mixing it up. Play another gamemode? Well, have fun playing alone because the only gamemode played is hunt.

Overall Evolve is just a bad experience.

EDIT: This doesn't mean i'm not going to go back to the game every now and then as i sort of like it and sort of don't. The question is though, would you recommend it? No.

reviewText:
I wanted to comment on the performance of the game. The engine is not conducive to high fps. The stutter and lag at +100 fps makes the game broken. (its not a spec issue as my highest CPU core of 4790K is at 40% and my GTX 980 Isnt Maxed Either). Lower graphics settings don't help either. Its a frametime variance issue. The engine simply cannot keep up.

I actually like the game and at 60 fps maxed out it is smooth and performs like a dream. I guess the argument could be made that at least its not the 30 fps of consoles but for a FPS the blur at 60 compared to 120 is a minor annoyance. (but not near as much as the hitching from the frame variance at high FPS). Again not a bad game, albeit quite repetitive.

Just wanted high FPS enthusiasts to know that their multi-thousand dollar rig simply cannot be fully utilized by this game.

reviewText:
Had the potential to be a co-op competitive fun fest on par with Left 4 Dead but is ultimately marred by a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ DLC model, very little in terms of content and game modes and a ridiculously stupid 'unlock' progression mode which promotes gimping of team play and all out tiresome grind.

The option to not 'prestige' your account/levels makes matchmaking a pain in the ♥♥♥ when there are very little level 40's queuing up and progression just bombs and the repetition kicks in what with their being very little game modes and variety.

Not at all newbie friendly with what I personally attest to being the most volatile and toxic community around...on par with LoL/DOTA etc not to mention the amount of moronic trolls who stay in games merely to ruin the game for others wanting to get the true 'Evolve' experience.

I did have some fun with Evolve but it was ultimately the player base (or lack there of) with their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ toxic attitudes that have really strained my enjoyment of Evolve.

Not recommended in its current state as it's lacking both content but also a decent playerbase and a pretty hefty asking price + DLC. The latest update of Arena mode really drove the nail into the coffin by offering a mode which essentially strips the game of what makes it 'exciting' and the core of the game mechanic (thrill of tracking, trapping and encountering the monster) and just dumbing it down thanks to the whines of idiots who can't play longer than 10 minutes and learn their class and basic game mechanics.

If it went free it quite possibly may be worth investing some time in it but new players will definitely feel the wrath of the higher level elitist scumbags who alienate players.

reviewText:
I can`t defend this game. I pre-purchased it 2 weeks before launch. I had the game pre-loaded. When the release date arrives and I try to launch the game it tells me I have to wait for a 50 mins update. Ok... My friend who bought it last sunday, pre-loaded after me had not to go through that bs update. After the update, the game simply DOES NOT WORK. IT DOES NOT LAUNCH. It even gets my windows task manager stuck. Frozen. I reboot the pc then, through steam`s verify game cache I see that the whole game installation is corrupted. Meanwhile, my friend who bought afterwards is playing the game just fine. I reinstall the game and played it once yesterday. Now when I try to launch the game again it fails to launch over 50% of the times.

Hey, Turtle Rock, a TIP, VERY USEFUL ONE. BEFORE LEAVING VALVE YOU SHOULD HAVE ASKED THEM HOW TO PROPERLY LAUNCH YOUR GAME ON STEAM. THIS IS F-ING STUPID AND A COMPLETE FAILURE AS LAUNCH. Major f-up.

Not to mention the loading screens / time. I mean wtf. First I have to wait for the matchmaking. Then for the map to pre-load. Then the character selection. Then another loading screen to wait for an animation to play the game. I am taking about 2-3 mins waiting to play a 6-8 min max match. WTF?! That even when I already have a full party line with my friends...

Just no... You don't deserve what you are asking for this game and its stupid dlcs. FIRST GET YOUR ♥♥♥♥ TOGETHER. GET THIS GAME WORKING PROPERLY. GET PEOPLE TO REALLY LIKE IT. THEN THINK ABOUT RELEVANT DLC. OR EVEN F-ING MICRO TRANSACTIONS FOR MOSTLY AESTHETICS. I DON'T CARE. BUT MAKE THE GAME WORK FIRST. PLEASE.

reviewText:
What the hell is wrong with these people who made this?

I played Evolve in the beta for awhile, but the game wasn't that great. There was zero training in the game, and you were immediately thrown at other players and died because you didn't know how to play yet. Once you did figure out how to play, there was such significant balance problems between the teams that most matches were over in less than a minute.

I really like teamwork games, so I had high hopes for this title, but everything I know about it says this is one that I should skip out on.

The game at release time is almost certainly much better than the beta experience, but that's not what my review is about.

I am not going to address gameplay here in my review at all.

The problems I have with this game are about juvenility, racism, DLC, and other stupid marketing and management a$$hattery.

Unfortunately, I know too much about the world we live in and it's history. I can't find Glorious PC Gaming Master Race" meme stuff funny. The people who do think it's funny don't believe they are being hurtful or malicious; they are just juveniles who don't know any better.

Turtle Rock has decided that it's okay to use race-based themes and terminology in their marketing of Evolve. I don't approve of the kind of people who thinks that's okay.

This game has day-1 DLC. That's a pretty serious game-publishing offense right there.

3GB patch on launch day isn't a good sign either.

The way Turtle Rock is selling their DLC also makes me seriously concerned. Other people have done a much better job of articulating the problems with their DLC
date: so I'll defer to the many news and opinion articles already out there on that subject.\n\nIn all
recommended: Turtle Rock and 2K did a great job of sinking this game before it even got our of port.\n\nHold off. Just wait a month or two and see what happens. Don't ride the Hype Train. Let other people get burned if this title tanks
hoursPlayed: and if it doesn't then players will still be playing in another month or two when it goes on sale.\n\nAt this point
voteText: I don't see how Turtle Rock/2K is going to get people to play this title without a major sale."

reviewText:
One word: Underwhelming

This game is not worth $60-$70 let alone the collector addition (DLC grab). Short and sweet, do not get this game unless it's on sale for 19.99-24.99 that's the value I can give it.

It feels lackluster in content at launch and launch DLC should never be the answer for that void.

The matchmaking is nothing more then a headache, often times waiting and stuck on waiting for a player to load. So you back out and get penalized. You wait minutes before you finally get into a game only to hope your team isn't useless.

The other issue is I can't even find a full team multiple times searching, this game is brand new and I can't get a full game. Then when you back out because you only have 2 players total, you're stuck with a leave penalty!

I can't help but feel so blah over this game. I have no drive to play it for a length of time, no drive to log in. It's a game I log in to play a match or two when I need a chane of pace from other games. Again, not worth the $70 for a time filler.

The game looks and sounds great but this should have been a micro transaction, free to play model or a properly done full game (which it's not).

Shame on the company/developers for this half baked junk.

I will say once you get a good group of people going, it can be a lot of fun but that cocktail of luck is far and too few between.

reviewText:
This game is fun and thrilling and new and then it gets old. I love the hide and sneak genre. For the price you get a polished product, but not much on game modes and single player content. I dont know if its just me, but i never connected with the hunters and end up half the time just jet packing around the arena, and that gets old, but i guess sometimes especially when i started playing in the beginning the hunt was a lot of fun, chasing down a monster. Playing the monster is even better trying to stay hidden in the first few minutes of the game takes skill and nerves of steal trying to outwit 4 other players, same reason i bought Watch Dogs with the hacking multiplayer and look how long that lasted. Same with Titanfall, it was a big bohaa in the beginning but also died a quick death after a short few months.

But here is the big reason I am not recommending the game, this is 95% mostly a multiplayer game and the servers are terrible. I had to much lag to really play decent games as the monster, though its more forgiving when you play a hunter. I have a 4mb line. So when the servers are bad i play single player, and well, playing with bots gets old very very quickly. I am bored, with no story or just the same stuff over and over, without multiplayer this game is boring, i'd rather play besieged. This is a game you totally have to play with your friends and you will have a good time, but this is a game i personally will play and then uninstall and never play again, same thing i did  with Watch Dogs. There is nothing that pulls me back, unless my friends wants to play and well, no one wants to buy it, i am blaming them so i am freeing up some 28gigs on my harddrive.

Maybe you have better friends or internet connection! Then buy it, i don't see any issues with the dlc packs, its mostly just cosmetic and doesn't add any real content, but if you didn't preorder like i did then to get all the extra stuff you will have to fork out a lot of cash, and well i dont think its worth it but if you are like me on the other stuff also, stay far far away.

reviewText:
Evolve is a multiplayer focused FPS.

The game pits 4 hunters against 1 monster. In the base game, there is a total of 12 hunters and 3 monsters available to choose from. The game offers no customisation aside from a selection of skins, of which only 1 per hunter/monster are not DLC. The progression system is purely linear and makes for a very unbalanced experience. Hunters/monsters work in tiers, where the next hunter/monster is better than the last, and only the same level of hunter/monster can have a good chance against other hunters/monsters. For example, four tier 1 hunters will find it near-impossible to take down the tier 3 monster, and vice-versa.

As well as balancing issues, the game is plagued with people of varying skill so it's always a game of chance as to whether or not your team will actually work as a team.

The game offers very little replayability due to the sheer lack of proper progression and customisation, and the lack of content, most of which is cut to be sold as DLC.

Speaking of DLC, this game is chock-a-block full of it. The game itself costs $60. From launch, 12 items of DLC are available to purchase, one of which is a season pass that includes none of the other content available to purchase. You can buy skin packs which offer 1 new skin for each 3 hunters in a class, that's 3 skins in total, for the low low price of $6. Or, you can buy one skin for each of the 3 monsters at the low low price of $10. The season pass itself is $25-30 depending on your region, and includes 4 new hunters (when they release). New monsters will also be available to buy for the grand total of $15-20.

You'd think for all the money they're charging, they'd at least release a game relatively bug-free and well polished. But no, that sadly is not the case. The game still has issues that were around in both alpha and beta. On top of this, the graphics are console quality, and the few CGI cutscenes are so badly compressed, my toaster could render a higher quality image.

The game is a total rip-off, and that itself is enough for me to not recommend this game. However, DLC ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ aside, the game's lack of serious progression and replayability is once again not enough for me to recommend a purchase. Maybe a year from now when the complete pack is $15-20, then you should pick it up. However at that point the game will be dead MP wise, and as SP isn't even worth mentioning, what's the point?

reviewText:
I'm just going by what I've seen in the reviews. I actually didn't buy the game, I played the Alpha.


Evolve is a 4 V 1 multiplayer game by 2K games and turtle rock studios. During the alpha it was kinda okay. I mean, nothing completely special. Just seemed like a more violent Tom & Jerry, except with 4 Toms and one Jerry. Like a lot of the games lately it's a great concept, but just poorly executed. From what I have seen, Evolve's release has been pretty much average so far. People make a good concept for the game, then. They ♥♥♥♥ you in the ♥♥♥ with Day one/Week one DLC. The game even in alpha seemed lacking. But, day one DLC that's almost a third of the full game's price? Which isn't even a fair price for what you're giving them. Why keep something as a DLC? You're literally making customers, people who have played games for years. To spend 100+ on one game, just to get the full experience. That's cheap. And honey, we don't buy in.

1/10 would bend over for you ;D

reviewText:
Love the game, love the concept, love the totally fun moments that are to be had playing this game & been the monster is just amazing at times.

However, after been to many gaming events leading up to this games release and seeing, hundreds and thousands of people waiting to play it and enjoying it immensely, the developers Turtle Rock and the publishers 2K, have screwed this up badly.

No matter how much these people say they want the game to work on PC they don't really care, and have let the game die on PC, too little too late. They do however seem to give a slight damn about the console version, and since the PC version lacks:-

Matchmaking
Teamwork with randoms
Fun
People
All player chat
Content
Real Single player campaign
In game voice command menu, i.e. ability tell players you need a heal and such
Access to Steam overlay

I'd just buy this on sale on the console of your choice. Unless this drastically changes, there is zero pointy buying this game on PC. It's just been an awful console port, with very little work done on it to make a decent PC game, which it really should have been, it's missing :-

Skill based Matchmaking
Dedicated Servers
Replays, but hay if you've got a tablet you can check them out on there, like its bloody Battlefield 4's commander mode
Monster only queue for matchmaking
Hunter only queue for matchmaking
Anti cheat (the ability to report a cheater), i.e. in cs:go you can report people from the scoreboard.

The balancing of the game to has also been laughable, they try hard it seems, but the game ends up been one sided with Hello Kitty versions of the monsters, which all the crying hunter players on the forums want, or under powered hunters, that all crying monster players on the forums want. The developers need to do what's best for the game and the playability as a whole, not pander to one section of the forums, to try keep their dying game alive longer.

I do NOT recommend this game at this time.

ps

Just tried the new arena mode, i'ts laughable, let’s take away the hunt and have a death match, skewed currently and heavily to the hunter player base.

This game is a great idea and it has taken that idea to the fullest extent possible (asymmetrical game play). However that is the end of the story. I'm just going by what I've seen in the reviews. I actually didn't buy the game, I played the Alpha.


Evolve is a 4 V 1 multiplayer game by 2K games and turtle rock studios. During the alpha it was kinda okay. I mean, nothing completely special. Just seemed like a more violent Tom & Jerry, except with 4 Toms and one Jerry. Like a lot of the games lately it's a great concept, but just poorly executed. From what I have seen, Evolve's release has been pretty much average so far. People make a good concept for the game, then. They ♥♥♥♥ you in the ♥♥♥ with Day one/Week one DLC. The game even in alpha seemed lacking. But, day one DLC that's almost a third of the full game's price? Which isn't even a fair price for what you're giving them. Why keep something as a DLC? You're literally making customers, people who have played games for years. To spend 100+ on one game, just to get the full experience. That's cheap. And honey, we don't buy in.

1/10 would bend over for you ;D

reviewText: Evolve is one of those games that could have been great but instead tripped on the start of the race and couldnt get up. I have played evolve since release and i enjoyed the start of it, when everyone doesnt know quite how everything works and its enjoyable. Turtle rock did distroy so much of the community by allowing wraith out the way she was (an uncatchable annoyance). Throughout my game time I have noticed a few things : Goliath is fun to face against, no one complains about them. If a Kraken player knows how to play they are unstoppable (Im talking a very good kraken player) And there are so many damn bugs and glitches in this game that the damn exterminator wouldnt know what to do with it. There are so many games where we lost due to a bug. Did the goliath throw a boulder at you while you where at full hp with no strikes? Well there is a glitch that causes it to one shot you. Laz on the team as the medic? Better hope bodies dont fall through the level or teleport accross the map. This game has so many bugs that each game you play you will always find a bug. Playing Parnell and have your shield on and then supersolder? Sometimes the supersolder activates but doesnt work if you do that. This game was in development for so long that i hate how many bugs it has. I do not recommend this game, its far more enjoyable to just watch someone on twitch play the monster or go play something else. Turtle rock you had my hopes up for this game. One of the biggest dissapointing games of the year.

reviewText:
April 21 UPDATE: As of now the games community has sharply declined and even duing the peak gaming hours I'm having a hard time to get full player games of those many are with people in other countries so you get lag and language barriers. I would highly recommend you not purchase this game as it is dying. I expect this in some of the cheap indie multiplayer only games but for a 60 dollar AAA title, on top of the DLC, to tank it's pretty shameful.

60 dollars is too much for a multiplayer only game like this (yes there are bot matches but the AI is normally good but can be unreliable) 15 dollars dlc monster and 7.50 for each trapper on top of that. Game feels slow either chasing experienced monsters around for 15 minutes for them to come stomp you at level 3 or finding newer ones quickly and killing them.

Edit: I should add while the 4 new Hunters have more unique/interesting weapons a lot of the default non-dlc ones tend to overlap and feel boring. Many of the weapons feel like I'm just pouring ammo into the monster unlike the visceral satisfaction you get from monster abilities.

reviewText:
Not sure whos to blame here, Turtle Rock or 2K but...
Heres my first ever negative review.

So much wasted potential on this game.

This game is amazingly fun and amazingly stupid at the same time. This game is 100% totally imbalanced.

Anyway, fun game completely ruined by unbalanced mechanics and alienation of original userbase by adding mountains of content at extreme pricing points.

reviewText:
Evolve is a game I have been waiting for many years. It’s a team of 4 soldiers against a Boss monster. It looks beautiful and as a rule plays very well with the right system. I did have a program on my computer that caused a lot of crashes (AVG Tuneup), but as soon as I uninstalled it Evolve has been solid!

There's been a lot of negativity around this game, mainly because of the DLC. Negativity has bred at a very fast pace around the game and the sad part is that most of it is just silly skin DLC that people are crying about, a lot of people have a need to buy every new skin that comes out which would prove to be an expensive addiction?  Personally, I only have the free skins I have earned in challenge weekends and haven't spent an extra penny on new skins at all.

You also need to buy new monsters and hunters too if you want them? If someone else has them you can still play with them though, so it's not a game changer if you don't have the characters yourself. Turtle Rock and 2K have learned a good lesson with pricing structure and as of late June 2015, you can buy the new characters ALOT cheaper than when Evolve was first relased. They've even included the latest monster in with hunting season 2, making it a very attractive addition to the game if like me you love it!

They are balancing the game constantly to try and make it as nice as possible for the players. There are bugs but the game is complex has been out for about 5 months (as of writing this review), they are working on them. There are different bugs for different people that make it harder to put right, perhaps like me different systems software is having an effect?

To me, I absolutely love the game and have neglected all other games in my library in favour of it.... I find it hard to understand the negativity of others?

reviewText: Boring. Disappointed. What can I say... I was really looking forward to this release and it just didnt live up to the expectation. The whole cat and mouse chasing the monster from one end of the map to the other thing gets boring really fast as a hunter and just rotating through the 4 moves you get as a monster makes for boring gameplay as well. At this point I feel like this is sorta one of those 'use your imagination' kinda games. They do a cool job of creating the environments and I really like the feel of the game (ie. chasing down a monster and engaging in combat and sorta the hulking feel of the monsters) but after a few rounds.. yeah, I dont feel compelled to keep playing. And if they gonna turn it into a big pay to play scheme that gonna suck too. Like, I see they are releasing a new hunter/monster pack but has anything changed about the gameplay?? Last I checked, no. So why am I gonna want to keep investing in this franchise? Just so I can get bored with new characters? Anyway, I'd really like to see them take what they have here and phrase it in terms of a new Rampage or King of Monsters type of game, that would be badass.

reviewText:
Evolve is a online multiplayer only title. So you should know already that it depends heavily on the player population remaining high enough. Honestly? I don't see that happening.

Asymetric gameplay is fine, but not when one side's ability to compete is locked behind a needless progression system. This throws any kind of balance the game would have out the window, especially when the matchmaking pits noobs against vets regularly, often to the frustration of all involved. Assuming you connect in the first place.
There just isn't enough meat here to hold anyone's interest. Much like Titanfall, the game has a few interesting ideas that just ended up falling back into standard multiplayer fare.

Closest recommendation I could offer instead with the same basic premise would be a source mod The Hidden. At least it's free if you own Half-Life2 (which using Steam, you should). Same basic idea as Evolve, and you'd have to play it with friends just to get a game going like you would with Evolve anyway. Really when you get down to the classes and the weapons and even the monsters, there just isn't enough incentive to play the same boring chase and occasional fight over and over. Its been done, and done much better for much cheaper.

reviewText:
First and foremost - I would like to really thank steam for FREE WEEKENDs!

And, for that - it made me realized that this game is actually....boring!  After 2 hours clocked into the game - finishing the tutorial as the monster and the assault and played some quick games, I've basically given up.

The concept was interesting - yet poorly executed.  Gameplay - this looks like a concept ripped out from other famous games out there - Left 4 Dead (Special Infected like the Tank against the other 4 survivors), Team Fortress 2 (where the 4 human players are of different classes), Diablo  (if you're playing as the monster it's like hack and slash and pick up the loot but in this case - EAT).  But for me, this feels like an overblown - PAC-MAN!!!  Being a monster at level 1 and 2 your are almost utterly worthless from the 4 human hunters so you must....RUN AWAY....chomp and at some point eat a power pellet (level up by evolving).  Then at level 3 you can now chase the other 4.  Where you deal each other damage until your armor goes down (Power-pellet ran out) and then you run-away again.  Chomping on those power pellets...errr...wildlife until you grow your armor back.  Then go after them again.  Rinse and repeat.  Being one of the 4 human hunters I felt a bit more fun, but it's more like Team Fortress 2 with a bit more jazz.

I can understand some reviewers' point of no one choosing to be the monster in this game.  It's utterly boring.  The human players are more than 20 times smaller than you.  You can't see their faces, it's like hacking some rag doll around but with overblown cheesy weapons.  Not like being the Tank" in Left 4 Dead where you can still see the brutality of plummetting your adversary to the ground and smashing their faces and enjoying every bit of it.

To be honest - this game would rather make me play Team Fortress 2 and Left 4 Dead 2 again - I've played both throughout these years and enjoyed them.  And I won't mind playing them again with my friends.  Will I play this game again even if my friends bought this? - Yes
date: as a human player.  But we'll all just be standing there staring at the wall - since no one would want to play as the monster."

reviewText: A phenomenal game! Though lacking on a story mode, this game does have a great story. We colonize Shear and the planet fights back. So they hire specific people to take care of the job. Each character has their own backstory and they interact differently with each other. Each character, though seperated into four different classes, are unique and aren't similar, though their classes are. The monsters are all unique too, they excel at certain things and they have their own flaws. The quality is here, but I can't recoment this game unless you have four more friends willing to buy it themselves with the player base slowly going away. This is a great game now, but when it launched, people stayed away because of the price and multiple purchasing ways. $60 for the base game, a deluxe version, a PC monster race version, the second season pass, it just alienated itself from everyone. I was confused, which one should I buy? Which one's worth it? though I got it on a steam sale, I still need to buy more for the game. If you do have friends who own it and are willing to dish out the money for the maximum content, its worth it, totally.

reviewText:
After playing this game I learned that most, if not all, of the negative reviews for this game are just wrong.

They don't do this gem of a game any justice.
That is why I am going to try my hand at writing down my thoughts. So bear with me.

Yes, I have had prejudiced thoughts about this game when I read the reviews.
Yes, I had thought it was overpriced for just a multiplayer game.
Yes, after playing this game for a while, everything I thought about the game had been turned around.
I strongly urge all of you who are thinking about getting this game to get it.
You will not regret it. If you already own it and gave up on it, then give it another try. Whatever the game's problems were at the start, I cannot seem to find any.
(Nothing that major, but i'll go into details later.)

~So, without further delay, Let us go into those aforementioned details.~

My thoughts.
The characters have chemistry together, they have personality, respond to whats going on around them. From the little -pre- game chats between characters to throwing Stasis grenades as Abe, and having him shout Have some of Abe's special little F*ck you's".
Its those nice little details that make the game more alive

reviewText: Might change my review once theres some patching and Anticheat systems added. Game started out alright and one could have a blast. However trainers and certain programs hinder the overall experience.  I know of a lot a fair ammount of people whose Win/loss ratios went from a 2.6 to nearly .5 or less once trainers were developped that allowed clipping, unlimited jetpack usage, monster instantly showing on hud/map/target area. I myself have witnessed games where feeding was perposely glitched out.  Place those games along side games where balance is way off and you get the .5 reasoning.  The average win/loss should hover at 1.2 to 1.0 for both sides. So far, its either horrible good or horribly bad. no goldielocks medium.  Like more thoughtout and tested games.  Granted i posted a positive review once before and i said before that it may be changed.

reviewText:
Don't waste your money on this game.

It's one of those games that has so much potential but then is executed really poorly. Considering some of the other reviews (Gamespot, Escapist, Polygon) I had high hopes for something like this. Now that I've paid for the game, 11,000 people playing the game with a peak amount of 19,953 is pathetic, and should be reflective of the type of game this is.

I love the concept of it, but the reality of it is so far detached.
If you're after this sort of game play, L4D & L4D2 are much, much better games.

The $60~ price point doesn't really meet the standards of many other gamers, and in my opinion, this game doesn't offer more content than the range of free games on the market currently. This game has far less content than games even at a $30 price point.

If you manage to get a few hours of game play out of it, that's great and I hope that you do. In my opinion, a month or two from now barely 5k people will be playing this. It's a dead game.

4/10.

reviewText:
You will want to like this game. You may even truly enjoy it (as i did). But in the end the amount of money you will spend on the game will not balance out with the amount of joy and time you get from the game. The sickening DLC policy (the second season pass is coming out now) will drive you away before you get your original money's worth.

By the time this game stops releasing new DLC to bleed you dry, and offers a reasonably priced ultimate edition, I fear the remaining community left to play with will be too small to enjoy it properly. This is at heart a good game that scared off the player base with greedy practices, but a good multiplayer game with no community isn't fun.

Some games earn the right to charge you for DLC. They offer new campaigns, enemies, skills, weapons, stories, etc. When you pay for it and play it you get the feeling that work went into making the DLC, and you don't feel ripped off for compensating people for their work. Evolve DLC feels very copy and paste with new artwork on top.

reviewText:
Amazing Game with too Many Problems?
Up To Date Review	Most of the Negative Reviews are from people mad about the DLC and marketing strategy Prior to release

Loved the Beta of this game but the initial DLC ($100) and multiple DLC Bundles turned me off at first, but I found a site that sold the monster race edition for 70USD and was the main reason I picked this game up. Now to the Pros and Cons.

WATCH THIS VIDEO IT SUMS UP EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO KNOW BEFORE BUYING THIS GAME
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFSpDjRMC8s

Pros:
Graphics
Gameplay / Mechanics
Unique Hunters, Monsters and Skills
Synergy between hunters
A New Multiplayer Experience (1 VS 4)
Occasional Great Match (That only really occurs when there’s communication, playing with friends)
The initial Awe when first playing the game.


Cons:
Game Quickly Gets Repetitive
There is essentially only one Mode (Hunt) which can be played Online with Randoms
The game has an arena mode but good luck finding a match
DLC, DLC, DLC  (So Many Editions, Bundles and skins)
Not including showing new DLC for the Season 2 Pass, but saying the new content would be released 8 months later
Graphics Bugs and Glitches (Flying, Monster Getting Stuck, Disco Party Lights that endues seizures, Falling through the Map, Daisy Getting Stuck, 2 Monsters or 2 of the same hunter  …. and the list goes on.
The Length of time it takes for the team to balance new content
Weak servers
Small Player Base (Highest is about 500)
The Player base is so small that the players are no longer able to successfully compete in the weekend hunter challenges.
Limited Player Progression (In which most people farm offline anyway)
Lack of Content, Lack of Single Player Aspect
Terrible offline AI bots (Hunters) the monsters are decent

EDIT 8/11/2015 ***The Newest Bug Take your DLC and Skins away bug"

reviewText:
You will want to like this game. You may even truly enjoy it (as i did). But in the end the amount of money you will spend on the game will not balance out with the amount of joy and time you get from the game. The sickening DLC policy (the second season pass is coming out now) will drive you away before you get your original money's worth.

By the time this game stops releasing new DLC to bleed you dry, and offers a reasonably priced ultimate edition, I fear the remaining community left to play with will be too small to enjoy it properly. This is at heart a good game that scared off the player base with greedy practices, but a good multiplayer game with no community isn't fun.

Some games earn the right to charge you for DLC. They offer new campaigns, enemies, skills, weapons, stories, etc. When you pay for it and play it you get the feeling that work went into making the DLC, and you don't feel ripped off for compensating people for their work. Evolve DLC feels very copy and paste with new artwork on top.

reviewText:
This game is good. Really good in fact. But I have a few issues with the game just like most others do.

A: This game costs too much for what it offers. I've gotten more content out of much, much cheaper games and on top of that we have to buy even more DLC lol what? I already paid quite a bit why do I need to pay more? It's already expensive just to buy the game itself.

B: Currently not enough players mostly because of the reaosn above

C: Major balancing issues. Wraith is pretty damn strong. Kraken was far too strong when I played and I rarely beat the thing because a ranged monster should be weaker than the others in terms of how many hits it can take but it simply wasn't.

D: First monster is pretty damn weak compared to the other 2. I never even see people use it. Needs buffs.

E: Another problem I had with the game was how biased this was towards the monster. The monster has no control over which maps get picked. The monster also has no way of really escaping the players becauseoo it's literally set up so that just when you run out of abilities to escape with their fuel runs out. Their tracking skills are also borderline broken. Make one wrong move and you probably are not going to escape their sights. So if you've had it easy as the monster it's because the players weren't working as a team or they were playing inccorectly. A good team of players can easily dominate the monster mostly because of the movement capabilities of both the monsters and the players being identical but the monster should have the advantage there but it just really doesn't.

F: The player revive mechnic is broken. I'm sorry but if I put in that much work to take someone out and they just get revived that takes all the fun out of the game for the monster and the will to even fight the players. If a player dies they should be punished and forced to respawn when the ship arrives. If the ship gets a shorter spawn time or the res time for players gets cut down or they take longer to revive I would be okay with that but um, I really get tired of having to stand on a dude and hope that the enemy is too stupid to attack me properly to make sure that he/she is dead. I don't mind the mechanic too much but at this point the game is so biased towards the monster it's just not even fair which may also be why they are so overpowered to an extent.

Well those are my problems with the game. It's a great game but it was ruined by the company sadly. If they shape up and fix the issues with the game then it will improve and get more players but right now it's not worth your time.

reviewText:
I don't know what's wrong with all these negative reviews.
I liked the game, very much!
It was so much fun! Every player has it's own role and one mission. Every time the fight begins it was so much adrenaline.

Game seems well balanced, I may be wrong, only played for a day. Though, that damn Wraith monster seems too powerfull! :)

Anyway, I liked playing as a monster, I liked playing as an assault and other hunters. If a team knows what they're doing, then the game will be great. If you're not so much a team player, then go for a monster.

Being a monster is all about running away, escaping from hunters to find food at the beginning. Cause there's no point to fight at stage 1. After you evolVe to stage 2, you can try to fight those little humans. But again, if there is an opportunity to escape, do it. At stage 3, nothing can stop you.

When you are a hunter, you have a lot of characters to choose from. Honestly, I have not played all of them. I only played as an assault, and a little bit as a medic.

There are 4 roles:
Assault - damage
Medic - healer
Support - buffer
Traper - traper
Every role has 4 or 5 different characters. So you can spend a lot of time playing as a hunter.

Every time you choose a character that you haven't played yet, you'll get a short brief on that character before match starts. It will explain special features of that character, and give a little tip on tactics.

I liked the overall graphics (GTX 750 Ti), the Dropship looks very good, the dialogs between teammates are hilarious, especially in the Dropship at the beginning :) Locations are some mix of jungle and technologically advanced stations.

The price tag... well it seems a bit high for me. But with 50% off now, it looks better(of course :)). A big bunch of DLCs looks confusing, feels like in a market. I just want to pay and play, is that too much to ask?

Anyway I recommend this game, it is fresh and fun!
voteText: 26 of 48 people (54%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Free Weekend's are pretty good. A developer can tip their hat about what's in their game - and show all the inner workings entirely free. It's pretty good if the game has some substantial core content, too. For example, I couldn't download it because my internet was too slow, but I remember Arma 3 had a Free Weekend, which I utilized by downloading the game and also buying it at the great sale price. But you could see from the content on display, there was some great bang for buck to be had, and there still is.

And now I see Evolve in the firing seat. I'd obviously heard the mixed reviews - all the DLC being thrown up for sale on release, the pricing structure etc - all very controversial stuff. So as I've downloaded it (which is already pretty big download and time spender) and have spent 40 minutes with the game, I'm not going to defend it. Evolve doesn't really know what to do with itself. The concept and idea are great - asymmetrical multiplayer. An example I highly recommend is Depth, which has 2 sharks against 4 divers. Unfortunately, in Evolve's case, I just find a lack of enjoyment. Killing Floor 2 also has a free weekend going, and I've spent an hour more in that than I have on this, purely because there was some enjoyment to be had. But for Evolve, I just don't see why you would buy it.

You download the game, get forced an obnoxious intro (I understand why it's there, but not why I can't quit it.) Still, 5 minutes later and I am in a game. I spawned as the AI in a current match and my character was getting pummeled by the 'Monster'. I spend the next 10 minutes watching the rest of them frantically run around before also meeting their fate to the monster. Apparently, just from reading some reviews, spawning as the dead guy happens a lot, which isn't good.

I fired up a second game. I choose the default Soldier, hunter, whatever. The guy with the lightening gun. And, 10 minutes of the match, what are we doing? Following some footprints. I liked the atmosphere - that whole 'where is it? it could come out any second - but because we were following, we got the jump on him. Still get pummeled. COmpletely annihilated. Is the game really this badly balanced?

I can't even remember if we did a third game. Must have because there was another Monster. Wraith, this time. Same thing happens - following, dying, but this time respawning. Yes, backup was en route, after another minute of an obnoxious 'lets not open the ship and jump out, lets just stand here crouched waiting for the hatch to jump out of opens. I feel like they caught an idea, and this thing whizzed through development. I really was expecting some, like, 'woah!' or 'hot damn!' moments from all the press coverage. Alas, seven months down the line, and it's already at 1/4 of the RRP. I kinda feel sorry for the developers - an attempted cash cow after getting too confident from the reception of L4D and L4D2. I think the Free Weekend and very, very cheap price is to inject a bigger playerbase into a dying game, but it looks like it went six feet under on release. Shame.

A good example of how to do asymmetrical multiplayer is Depth - tension, speed, action - brilliant stuff. I'd say it's also well balanced, considering if you're bad as shark or diver you'll easily die. The content I'd say is slightly shallow - only a handful of maps - but in my books, it's written how to do asymmetrical. Evolve simply isn't it. A good shot, but it's not what you're looking for.

reviewText:
Played on a free weekend.  I had been interested in this game when it was released, but not at $60 and not with all the money grubbing DLC.  Playing it this free weekend confirmed that I made a good choice.  It was ruined for me by, in no particular order:

1) Many of the weapons/tools were bland and similar.  They looked different, but felt the same or filled the same role in slighty different ways.  The ones that were different were usually terrible.
2) Matchmaking was poor.  Stomp the monster in 30 seconds or be destroyed.  Didn't like that person?  Enjoy playing with them again because there is no one else.
3) The time to get into a game is just out of control.  Wait for a player.  Wait for map to load.  Wait to pick role.  Wait to start match.  Wait to jump in and start playing.  It takes 3-4 minutes after the match fills to start playing.  Combine this with bad matchmaking and it is painful.
4) Dialogue repeats constantly.  If you didn't know what a beret is you will.
5) Random bugs.  Badges copied to everyone.  Party members randomly being kicked on load.  Nothing game breaking, but so far past release it lacks polish.
6) lul Wraith.

While the concept is cool, it plays like a beta and has the content of a bad free to play despite costing an uncomfortable amount of money (with DLC especially).  Pass this one up.

reviewText: My friend and I tried playing this game and while we enjoyed the concept and wonderful graphics, the gameplay is horrid. reviewText:
TL/DR
Despite peoples frustrations, this game is actually good if you are willing to learn how to play


It took me a long time to decide to buy EVOLVE. I was really turned off by all the DLC and all the negative reviews and all that normal stuff that seems to be bothering people. This game goes on sale a lot, if you don't want to pay full price, just wait and it will go on sale. and the DLC isn't too expensive and you don't even need it to have a good time really. I started the game with none then slowly got it all.

As for gameplay actually goes I think the game is made really well. Being a monster is really fun. Sometimes it's easy because the hunters are bad, and sometimes it's hard becuase the hunters are good. Maps are pretty balanced and so are the hunters. Sometimes you will be hunted by a team that is a really good comp and you will lose and feel like they were to powerful, but that's kinda one of the point as hunters, to build a good team to hunt with, so that's just the game working or you not being good.

As the hunters the game can be frustrating, because if one hunter isn't preforming their role correctly, it really messes up the team. But it is still really fun. As long as you put in a bit of time to learn the maps, the monsters, and the hunters. Once you figure out things like that, which you can do in a solo mode that is just like the online mode but is easier cause the bots aren't very smart in this game, being a good hunter isn't hard. If you have trouble finding good teams, you should probably friend people that you play with that do well, so you can party up. And honestly if you think your team isn't doing well, you should just get a headset and talk to them, as long as you aren't a jerk, people will usually work together, which is what this game is about.

this isn't a game that you are going to turn on, and start winning, unless you are pretty smart and already understand most of the game mechanics. It takes a while to know the maps and know how to fight each monster. But that's the same for most shooter games. you start off bad not knowing anything, then you learn the maps and how you like to play.

some PROS:
challenging gameplay that takes skill to learn.

So many hunters and monsters have been released that most matches are very different.

Different from almost every other online shooter.

When the game goes on sale, being the monster is easy cause all the noob hunters.

some CONS:
the match making system is kinda annoying. hopefully they will update it someday.

ranking system is difficult to ascend.

sometimes players are stupid and don't listen
voteText: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is amazing.

In other games I've always loved being the little guy in cat-and-mouse situations, from hunting tanks in Battlefield, to slaying dragons in Skyrim. Evolve makes an entire game out of that concept, even allowing you to play as the monster. And it's competitively balanced!

The hunters all have jetpacks and infinite ammo, and have to hunt the monster before it can eat enough to stage up. By stage 2, the monster is said to be on equal ground. By stage 3, it turns into a generator defense where the mosnter hast he advantage. At this point, a good amount of teamwork is needed by the hunters to win. Tricky in public games, but very satisfying when you can finally take out the monster.

And the game looks beautiful, being built on Cryengine. All of the plants and creatures in the game (some very hostile) fit seamlessly into the game world, making it easy to immerse yourself in.

And the DLC hunter releases are very high quality. They look stunning, are really fun to play, and have a surprising amount of lore brought with each release as well.

Most of people's complaints from release have basically been addressed. The only prominent issue right now is the size of the player base, making queue times for ranked extremely long. One can generally find a game pretty quickly in Quick Play, though.

I would highly recommend buying this. For you and your friends.

reviewText: Been there since the Alpha, bought the PC Monster Race Edition and had (mostly) nothing to complain about. If you have a solid team by your side, there's a good chance that you will love this game.. The game is awesome, it is tons of fun once you figured out how to play it and it becomes a challenging experience if you play against or with other more experienced players. I love it. I have always loved it, for it's unique concept, the fun we had as a team, the times when we were frustrated just to swear to ourselves to do it better next time.. We watched videos, read blogs, tried a few things ourselves and we did become better at the end. Maybe even more than good, which just made it more fun! You will need tactics and yes, it will take time to simpy get good, but, at least in my humble opinion, it was absolutely worth every minute.

reviewText:
TL/DR
Despite peoples frustrations, this game is actually good if you are willing to learn how to play


It took me a long time to decide to buy EVOLVE. I was really turned off by all the DLC and all the negative reviews and all that normal stuff that seems to be bothering people. This game goes on sale a lot, if you don't want to pay full price, just wait and it will go on sale. and the DLC isn't too expensive and you don't even need it to have a good time really. I started the game with none then slowly got it all.

As for gameplay actually goes I think the game is made really well. Being a monster is really fun. Sometimes it's easy because the hunters are bad, and sometimes it's hard becuase the hunters are good. Maps are pretty balanced and so are the hunters. Sometimes you will be hunted by a team that is a really good comp and you will lose and feel like they were to powerful, but that's kinda one of the point as hunters, to build a good team to hunt with, so that's just the game working or you not being good.

As the hunters the game can be frustrating, because if one hunter isn't preforming their role correctly, it really messes up the team. But it is still really fun. As long as you put in a bit of time to learn the maps, the monsters, and the hunters. Once you figure out things like that, which you can do in a solo mode that is just like the online mode but is easier cause the bots aren't very smart in this game, being a good hunter isn't hard. If you have trouble finding good teams, you should probably friend people that you play with that do well, so you can party up. And honestly if you think your team isn't doing well, you should just get a headset and talk to them, as long as you aren't a jerk, people will usually work together, which is what this game is about.

this isn't a game that you are going to turn on, and start winning, unless you are pretty smart and already understand most of the game mechanics. It takes a while to know the maps and know how to fight each monster. But that's the same for most shooter games. you start off bad not knowing anything, then you learn the maps and how you like to play.

some PROS:
challenging gameplay that takes skill to learn.

So many hunters and monsters have been released that most matches are very different.

Different from almost every other online shooter.

When the game goes on sale, being the monster is easy cause all the noob hunters.

some CONS:
the match making system is kinda annoying. hopefully they will update it someday.

ranking system is difficult to ascend.

sometimes players are stupid and don't listen

reviewText:
Alright Evolve what a game.
I understand there are mixed reviews about this game but I love it! Its one of those games in my opinion where you can boot it up, have a few games and happily log out.

The characters are fantastic and all have their own personality, I play the Medic class most of the time and all of them are unique in their playstyle. My favourites being Slim, Caira and the brand new one E.M.E.T (psycho robot that heals people? Yes please! XD)
The monsters are all very unique in playstyle and require tactic to get down. For example, do not expose yourself to a Wraith, otherwise she'll abduct you. Don't clump together against a Behemoth or Kraken, otherwise their AoEs will knock you all down.

Sure people are a bit miffed that they have to buy the new hunters, but IF you don't want to, then don't buy them its that simple. They do competitions pretty much every week to unlock unique (FREE) skins for your favourite hunter, or monster :D mine by far is the Voodoo Goliath (Goliath in black with skeletal patterns all over it looks neat!) that i achived by just playing one game (you don't even need to play the Goliath, just get in a game with one in it) and hit the Rock Throw at hunters. The same with hunter contests, you don't have to play the hunter that gets the skin, just have one on your team! I have so many for Maggie and I barely play her, but its awesome to see Daisy in different skins <3

I would say the look of the game is very stunning. Fire effects especially :) The Wraiths teleportation trails look awesome and Kraken's lightning looks great too, even though it is a little strong, but that's my opinion of course.
If you're wanting a game that looks nice when played and just to casually play an extreme game of hide and seek, I would recommend this game :)

Any of you wanna play? Just add me :3
