reviewText:
After seeing a bunch of gameplay videos of Evole i couldn't wait to play it. I expected it to be really fun and interesing,
and after playing for about 10 hours during the Free Weekend i can say that the game met my expectations almost perfectly!

Every match was exciting and fun. Despite the seemingly repetetive nature of the gameplay, every match felt different. Different characters really felt unique, and every monster had it's own feel as well. One match would feel like an exciting chase. Another would become a tence hunt where the hunters have no idea where the monster is, and the monster had an awesome stealth experience lurking around and confusing the hunters. Another match might burst into action in the first 2 minutes and become a long, continuous epic battle.

It's true that it's hard to actually find a match with people to play, but the reason for that is the overwhelming and often unjustified negative feedback on the game...
Everything you read about the dlc pricing, for example, is as relevant to the base game's review as saying that the steak wasn't tasty because the icecream was too expensive...

But even if you don't find a multiplayer game, you can just as well play solo with bots, which have surprisingly good AI, that will 95% of the time act like an actual person, employing different tactics with different characters, and being more effective with those characters then the avarage person, creating a more interesting gameplay experience.

Is it worth the full price? I think it does though you could always wait for it to be on sale.

Is the dlc overpriced? Maybe, but you don't have to buy it. The base game has 15 unique characters (including the
monsters), that will probably give you 20-30 hours of enjoyment at least.

Are there balancing issues? Maybe. I didn't notice and didn't care. I won some games and lost some games and it was fun.

Is this game for everyone? Probably not. You should check some gameplay videos to see the variety and depth of the game and decide for yourself if you like it.

Overall, i had fun with this game and want to play more, so i recommend it to you as well.

reviewText:
Hi,

I'll explain the game as it is. You either hate it or love it.
I am a FPS fan. I play CoD and I find (in my experience) that this game is way better that any multiplayer game I've played so far.

Let me explain why.

1) NO hacking or cheating, ever. Like period. This game is TurtleRock's baby and believe me, they want this to be the most fun game there is.

2) The whole TurtleRock development team LISTENS to you. You don't like the game? Why don't all the haters out there just tell it to them directly on their forums: https://talk.turtlerockstudios.com/. Every issue you have in-game, may it be bugs, balance issues, they WANT to know. They post what they are currently working on and are more than eager to listen what you have to say.

3) This is a game where you need to have SKILLS. I lost a couple of matches as the Monster, then I won a few. I do find that the more I play, the more I know how to deal with situations that increase my chance of winning. This is a game that really rewards you for being good and even has a leaderboard to show for it.

4) Free skins. Wait, let me repeat that again, FREE SKINS. TurtleRock does (almost) every weekend a challenge where, if you complete the goal (either as a community or in person), you get the free skin added in-game.

Honestly, the base game is all you need and most definetely will keep you playing for a long long time before you should even consider buying the extra DLC. This because people should wait with playing with the 4th and 5th tier hunters until they have more than enough experience to put them to good use. If you mad cause you lost, I challenge you to play the tutorial first under the time limit of 6 minutes and THEN start playing some SOLO games before going multiplayer.

SUMMARY: This is for all the haters out there with 0.5h of gameplay bashing the game. Cosmetics cost too much? No worries, you get FREE skins when participating in Challenge Weekends. DLC cost too much? Really? The base game is all you need and if you find the price is still too high, just wait for a Steam sale. For the rest, this is such a good and diverse multiplayer game that deserves the praise that TurtleRock deserves. Try it, take your time to learn the mechanics and most importantly, enjoy it.

reviewText:
As much as I would want to like this game, I just dont.

After 69 hours on launch and even more on Big Alpha & Closed Beta I have to say that do not buy this game.
Why?
- Numerous bugs (affecting mostly the monster play)
- Low map pool
- Low interactivity
- Poor balance on hunters (tier 4 is op and unenjoyable to face)
- Poor balance between monsters
- Some of the maps are way too punishing for certain monsters
- Map designation done priorly thinking of Goliath
- The game can be such a snore-fest most of the time
- The patching takes a long time (meaning how often the devs patches this game, even though it is in dire need of it)

This game certainly does have it's high moments. But the good moments are way too rare.
The game does look good, but the mechanics are flawed (especially on monster).

This game can and will cause huge amount of frustration and little sense of achievement.

Do I have to mention the price of DLC" on this game? oh my

recommended: buy something else. You will be much happier."

reviewText:
This should be a fun game.

Sometimes, it is a fun game.

Most of the time, however, it is not fun.  There are glaring balance issues, to the point that in several situations, it is common for one character to carry an entire game, even if his teammates are lousy to the point of useless.  And bugs.  I have had this game for barely over a week, and my wins and losses have been determined more often by players freezing up, getting locked into special-ability animations, or just flat-out losing their attack abilities.

Fix this game.  One player should not be able to carry a team.  There should not be a one in three chance that the match outcome will be decided by a bug.  How the hell did problems like this get past beta?

reviewText:
I enjoy this game and was conflicted if I should recommend it, but I feel very upset with the current system in place based on the current $59.99 price. As of 08April2015, it is $34.00 on ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥

I enjoy the game play, even the running around portion which other reviews may disagree with. Match making doesn't take very long and usually it is not a full party, however players are quick to join once the match starts  and matches typically end with a full party. Graphics are wonderful and the characters are fun.

My biggest complaint and the reasons I gave this a negative review are...
1.) Current DLC content for new characters are $15 for the 4th monster and about $7 or $8 for each 4th tier hunter; I feel like what I currently purchased is all that I'll ever have for this game, and I'll never experience new hunters or monster game play. I will not buy these new characters unless they go for $2 on ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ which I don't expect for year. To me updates for new content will not happen

2.) If you play in a party with a friend, you cannot be the monster unless you play in a custom game; this is to prevent players throwing the game to help level their friend's character or to help them in the leader boards. My friend and I do not play customs because there is no way to include other players except by invites - that leads us playing with bots, an extremely inferior mode for us compared to playing with real people. When playing with others in normal match making, it becomes boring only playing as the hunters and incredibly frustrating knowing that this game could be much more fun without this feature.
The game would deserve the 9/10 scores I see on the big name sites if these issues were fixed imo.

reviewText:
You can't seem to talk about this game without talking about DLC, understandibly so. Before I get into this review I will state that while I like the core concept of DLC it has been poorly implemented into games in the past few years, this game is no different.

TL;DR- At it's best, this game is a blaze of glory and fun that maybe even rivals L4D's co op central idea. At it's worst though...It is a drab and has tedious stretches of nothing happening. This game went SUPER aggressive on the DLC front and while the dlc is currently harmless considering it's simply skins(Which are usually made AFTER the game is done and is waiting to be shipped, and the artists need something to do. A fact that many people forget)  It is just ♥♥♥♥ing stupid for the monsters to be priced at 15$ a pop, and hunters 7.50$ a pop. Buy this if it is on sale for sure, it really is worth 30$ to maybe even 35$ 60$ is just too hard to swallow. ♥♥♥♥ing great with friends, poor with solo.

Story (5/10)

Chaos! A planet named Shear has become overrun with giant monsters and it is up to 12(currently) of the galaxies best hunters to help evacuate the planet of it's colonist. Nothing special here, no real plot really just a few back stories on each of the characters. Much like L4D and L4D2 in fact, only in those games there were writings on the wall and many conversations between the survivors to make the story seem fleshed out. This game lacks many of those boosters.

Graphics (No rating)

The game looks good, then again it is not hard to make a game look good anymore, you have to TRY to make a game look bad now.

Gameplay (7/10)

It's fun! Mostly anyway. You can either play as one of the 12 hunters which divide up into 4 classes(3 per role) Trapper, who aptly traps the monster. Medic, who you know, heals the team, assault who does the most damage to the monster or the support who can do a multitude of things such as shield allies or bomb the living ♥♥♥♥ out of the monster with an orbital strike. Then there is also the famed monster role, you can either be the severely underpowered goliath who breathes fire and can't run away for ♥♥♥♥. The kraken, who reigns death from above while looking like the president of the Cthulu fan club. He seems to be the most balanced of the 3 monsters. Or the wraith, who will supernova your ♥♥♥ into next week. Below i will go into each class and monster in a bit more detail.

Assault- As stated above, the main damage dealer of the group is this guy, He has a personal shield when he gets up close and personal and can very from having a gun that shoot lighting to a flamethrower. This class is pretty fun to play and as for the people who complain that they can't use the mines on the kraken, that is why you have Val Abe or Griffin, your team must be well prepared for ANYTHING.

Trapper- My personal favorite class. This class can use harpoons or stasis grenades to impedes the monsters movement, they can bring down the thunderdome where the monster is forced to fight, and use medium damaging guns. The class is pretty well balanced and feels the newest out of all the class types.

Support- I honestly don't know how to describe this class because they do all sorts of ♥♥♥♥ and feel like the most versatile of the group. The class is okay i suppose. Hank's beard is magnificent.

Medic- Do I really need to explain in detail what a medic does? THEY HEAL ♥♥♥♥. Minus Laz who just watches his team die so he can res spam.

Goliath- Really underpowered, this monster is meant to be the brawler" of the bunch but I always found myself getting stomped. Where the other two monsters can run away at stage 1 this guy CAN'T get away due to his slow movement. Stage 2 tends to solve this somewhat. His whole moveset should be able to do more damage
date: NONE of his moves feel like they pack a punch. This is a shame that even at level 3 he doesn't feel powerful because if they patched him he would probably be the funnest.\n\nKraken- My personal favorite. Certainly the most balanced of the bunch
recommended: between have mostly skillshot abillities that have good payoffs and the flying abillity he is certainly the most refreshing of the bunch\n\nWraith- SUPERNOVA ALL DAY EVERY DAY. Seriously though
hoursPlayed: after the post beta patch the wraith feels much more balanced and feels like a hit and run character now
voteText: they still have not justified taking abduction though. It just simply isn't as potent as decoy supernova and warp blast.\n\nOh wait
helpfulPercent:

Now while 95% of it is skins there is no way to unlock the skins in game which is kinda bull. there is also the 7.50$ per new hunter and the absolutely ludicrous pricing of 15$ for a single monster. 2K NEEDS to lower the pricing. Now one nice thing though is that even if you don't buy the monsters or hunters you can still fight them just not play as them. All maps and game modes will be free which is nice to.

Endless loading screen. Endless timer. Game starts. People start typing things like "What's taking so long?" Wait a second...Is there a host? Was I the host? Was the game just not starting? Everyone leaves. I leave. One more time. Endless loading screen. Endless timer.....what's that? HOLY CRAP I'M IN THE GAME. MONSTER'S ALREADY ON STAGE 2 BUT I DON'T CARE. SO EXCITED. Lag Central. Again. I hear voices perfectly but I can barely move. I try shooting my gun at a little dog thing running by. I lose bullets but nothing happens. I'm done with this.

Yeah

I wish the game was more like the Alpha and Beta. Here is a list of reasons why I LOVE the game, and a list of reasons why I HATE the game:

Love:
-Insanely good graphics
-The concept is original
-Playing as the monster OR the hunters, awesome
-You can play with, or against your friends
-Create your own custom game with friends, do solo, with a partner, etc.
-Character Commentary is funny and highly interesting
-The wild life can make or break a match
-Wraith's abduction: Awesome
-The 3 stars for each character for each item takes a long time. Makes you play it more. I like that about the game.

Hate:
-Jet Pack is a joke. The Jet Pack was actually better in the Alpha and Beta than in the actual game
-So many things are over-powered (Example: Wraith's Clone, The Kraken, Minions, etc)

reviewText:
Let me start by stating two conflicting things. First, I really liked this game. Second, I will not be purchasing it. In the time I've tried this game for the free weekend, I've had a great time. It suffers from all the things any game with online features suffers from; abhorent online community, annoying voice chat system that does more harm than good, and not so cooperative coop system. But those things generally were few and far in between. When things went right, and they often did, the game was amazing. The vast array of diverse options in terms of classes to pick from is amazing. And even within those classes for the Hunters, each class has a up to 5 unique characters with abilities unique for that character and class combination, making the different team combinations a very fluid and unque experience. Mind you, there are some combinations that are rather obviously better than others for certain situations. Bucket's Support ability to lay down turrets for example is amazing for defense games, but no so great for hunting.

All that aside, I still won't be buying the game, because all those great aspects of the game I just described like the diverse roster and combinations of classes are not readily available in the full game. They've been sectioned off as separately paid content. Mind you, I'm still recommending this game because it is still an all around solid game. But I'm certainly not going to pay $80 full price to condone the marketing practice of splitting content that should have came with a game to begin with.

But if money is no issue for you, and a company's business practices are of no consequence to your conscience, then look no further. Evolve is reat game. The way it is sold is ♥♥♥♥.

reviewText:
To put it simply, its a fun concept, but not fun to play.

After playing through the game solo with NPCs (once as the hunters and once as the monster), and a few matches with other players, I was already bored. At that point you've already seen and done everything there is to do multiple times, and none of it is -that- fun or exciting.

Solo queue as a hunter is pretty terrible, as hunters really need to be coordinated and function as a cohesive team in order to win. And the odds of getting that kind of teamwork with 3 other random players is pretty low. Couple that with a brutal learning curve no matter what hunter/monster you're playing as, and you can expect to lose a LOT during your first 8+ hours of play. For me, there just wasn't enough reward, enough fun factor to balance how punishing it was to get into. I bought the all-inclusive package at a deeply discounted price during a steam sale (circumventing the MASSIVE issue I had with this game in regard to day 1 dlc and the blatant money-grab that was going on at launch) and I still regret my purchase. Its just not worth the time, money or effort.

reviewText: Don't buy into the pre-launch hype.  This game is not even remotely close to the fun that Turtle Rock created with the Left 4 Dead series.  The game modes, while fun for a few rounds, get extremely boring after a few run throughs.  The characters have no personality and a mere 5 days post purchase, I find myself struggling to get through a single match per evening.  Even if you have a core group of friends that you play with, which in my opinion is critical to enjoying this game longer term, I question if even then the game becomes a regular habit.\n\nAvoid buying ANY DLC if you already purchased and if you're still on the fence, wait for 2K to drop price and don't even consider picking it up for less than 75% off - even then I think you're wasting your $.

reviewText:
It really is hard for a gamer, when a game put you between loving a game or just hating it. Now for a moment, close your eyes and forget about all the DLC's they have put out in the first week of it's release (Let's stop the Hate for a second). Now my review is based solely on the Base game that they have released.

Let's be honest - The idea when it was first shown really interested me and I am definitely sure that like me, many gamers were waiting for this game eagerly. I for one constantly kept tracking the Game's news, video reveals of the monsters, gameplays shown at game conferences. It really got me hyped, plus I was happy that Turtle Rock Studios got a good Game at their hands - A game which was getting positive reviews. Now that the game released, what's my reaction? Read on to know.

GAME MODES - [8.5/10] Evacuation, Hunt, Rescue, Nest and Defend <- Individually all these game modes are fun, at least for me it was fun and I am enjoying it. Hunt - The Hunters must kill the Monster before it can destroy the power relay located in the map. The Monster must reach stage 3 in order to destroy the relay, though it can also opt to kill all of the Hunters. Nest - Six Monster eggs are located in random locations on the map. The Monster must protect them from the Hunters for 18 minutes, and can hatch one of the eggs to spawn a minion to help it. The Hunters must destroy all six eggs, as well as any minions, within the time limit to win. Rescue - Injured colonists trying to escape the Monsters are placed randomly on the map. Hunters need to locate, revive and protect them as they make their escape. The monster needs to kill as many of these colonists as possible and keep them from getting away. Whoever saves—or kills—five colonists first wins. Defend - A starship's refueling station comes under the assault of a player-controlled fully evolved monster and smaller Goliath minions. The hunters must stop the monster from causing a catastrophic accident by protecting the power generators until the ship is fully powered, while the monster must destroy two generators to reach the ship's power source. These are the 4 Base game modes available in the game and Evacuation is an interesting concept which boasts about having more than 800,000 different outcomes - Evacuation is a short Campaign style game where all these 4 game modes may be included. Average time for an Evacuation campaign is around 45-60 mins.

GAMEPLAY - [8.5/10] I will keep the Game Play part short as it is quite easy to get a hold off. Once you go through the tutorial and watch the videos provided, you will be ready to tackle the game head on. Controls are okay, controlling the hunters feels like the usual FPS style and controlling the monster is a whole different ball game but it is quite fun in the end.

STORY - [6/10] Who said the game had any story? jokes aside, Evolve is set on Shear, a distant planet located in the Far Arm" of space
date: that humanity has traveled to in the distant future. The established colonies
recommended: considered the most valuable in this region of space
hoursPlayed: are soon attacked by malevolent alien Monsters (Where did I hear this before?). As the Monsters destroy the colonies on Shear

helpfulPercent: in order to evacuate the remaining colonists from Shear. In response

The Voice acting has been done pretty good and it really makes you care a little about the characters that you are playing. (You usually hear them talking throughout the game and usually at the start - it's quite neat). Now the Monster part - When it Roars and it keeps running around in the distance

reviewText:
How the meta is set for in-game matches

Common scenario #1:You run around for 20 minutes chasing a monster and then you have a 30 second brawl in which the hunters usually lose.

reviewText:
As it is, is it worth $60? That's for you to decide. Can I recommend this game? Unfortunately, I cannot.

Some Goodies:
Impressive art.
Diverse dialogue depending on party selection and other situations.
Different game play in a 4 v 1 setting.
A whole slew of pallets and backgrounds for the badges to customize your profile.

Some Issues:
No opportunity (even if a small one) to rejoin a disconnected game. Perhaps pausing the game briefly like in MOBAs like Dota or LOL.
The ranking system has no validity. People on the top with zero deaths/losses just leave the match if they are about to lose. Because of this really, being topped ranked means little to nothing.
No unranked matches for players to just play (and not against bots in solo). Plenty of games have this.

Some facts:
The community is shrinking and shrinking. Price is the eliminating factor. The view count on twitch has decreased ever since the announcement that the game will be pay2play. It will cost gamers $15 a monster and for the new four hunters it is $25. Already it's $100. And it's still rising.  Sadly, I fear that the companies greed is going to make this already small community diminish.


Some Opinions:
Spawn locations for wildlife appears to be static. If it were randomized it would change every match.

The disregard for the ranking system by the developers is just dumb. Other games have safeguards to prevent this. A simple safeguard so that disconnecting counts as a loss/death would help. Though I do think there should be more to the ranking system, as the players you face are random.

It is my hope that the developers absorb the criticism from those who want to make this game better and more accessible.

reviewText:
It says I've only played for 13 hours, but that doesn't include the console version which I have much more experience on. With that out of the way, I'd like to say I really, really enjoy Evolve. It's a unique concept that has great gameplay and team mechanics for the Hunters and useful tools for survival as the Monster.

Pros:

Gameplay: B+ This game is a lot of fun with friends and also playing solo. You can't play online leaderboards as the Monster if you are with friends, but that's okay since people would just boost themselves to the top of the leaderboards. Very well thought out characters and unique abilities to choose from.

Teamwork: B- (A+ with the right team, but we'll get to that)

Monster Playability/Replayability: C+(also will get to this later)

Graphics: A (I use low settings and I'm still satisfied)

Diversity of Levels: A+ Every map/level has the feel of being an alien planet yet each level has a signficicant difference from the rest.

Cons:

Singleplayer Campaign: F----        There is no singleplayer campaign that is different from the multiplayer aspect of the game. (F is for For real
date: Turtle Rock?")\n\nMonster Playability/Replayability: C+ I play mainly as the Hunters because I tend to stay with friends. This is not a problem. The problem is that the majority of Monsters we fight are either Wraith or Meteor Goliath. Wraith is a sneaky little prick that is so overplayed it isn't even fun (also
recommended: they are just annoying to play against; seriously

reviewText:
awesome game! make it free to play, or reduce the price, and i will own this game for sure.   unfortunately there are a lot of in game things you can buy for real money, nothing that will make the players who spend real money OP, but cool stuff that many players will wish they had such as different hunters, monsters, and skins.

Really fun though, definitely unique, and well balanced. also i have read some people complaining it wasn't balanced because the wraith just hid and wrecked everyone.  this is not true though, although the wraith can hide and escape better than most of the other monster classes, he is killable, even at stage 3 if you have a good team who knows what they are doing.  Wraith also has a bit lower health to balance out its escape and damage.   Also once you get to stage 3 with any monster, you are really hard to kill, not just with wraith.

so yeh, super fun game not pay to win,  but it is not one payment for all content which is why the need to reduce the game price, or have everything unlocked with one purchase.  if you are willing to deal with the money, then this game will reward you with an amazing experience like no other

reviewText:
I have owned this game on the PS4 and it was a capped 30 fps, which you could understand is not a very good frame rate for a shooter. But on PC playing in 60fps was a huge improvement. My graphics card was unable to run the game in a very high performance rate.

GPU: AMD Radeon R9 270

But even though i had to settle for Medium graphics the game still plays an impressive part in Predator vs Prey, the battle to see who come out to be the true Predator, and the prey..

For PC? i give this game a very high rating. Still exceeds my expectations and they have a whole new variety of badass to unveil.

If you are a gamer for Stealth, Agression, Teamwork and Many modes, maps and gameplay variety i suggest Evolve to be a title that is worth more than a try.
PS: I wish i could run the game in Very High, But still very Very VERY satisfied.

Happy Gaming!

reviewText:
When it's good, it's very, very good.
When you are part of a friendly team of hunters, the game can be really fun. Each player fully into their class, and supporting each other. It's really the players that make the game.

Or when you are a monster, and provided you don't get caught near the edge of the map it can also be really tense and exciting. The same heart pumping thrill you get from playing Alien Isolation, when you are running to save your life.
And the power, when you are fully evolved is great. Although you never really feel  empowered like you do in say the game prototype". I guess it's a kind of lack of connection between the monster and the hunters during combat. You never really feel like you are throwing them around like toys. You just keep plugging away until their health bars reach zero.

But when it's bad... it's horrid.
Waiting
date: ... waiting waiting for a game. Waiting for fellow players. Waiting for the three countdowns before you can play again. Seriously. Countdown at the end of the game. Wait for players to rejoin. Countdown to selection of classes. Countdown to selection of character in your class.... Then waiting for loading
recommended: then waiting for the terrible unnecessaryily sweary cutscene to finish. There are more countdowns than the tv show of the same name.\n\nThen
hoursPlayed: you start the game only for one of your team to quit
